question: 'Lead time' refers to the time between:
exp: Lead Time Lead time is the advantage gained by screening (leading the time of diagnosis). It is time between First possible point of detection and usual time of diagnosis.
opa: Disease onset and first critical diagnosis
opb: Disease onset and first possible point of detection
opc: First possible point of detection and final critical point
opd: First possible point of detection and usual time of diagnosis
topic_name: Definition and Concepts, Examples from NHPs

question: Diagnostic power of the test is reflected by:
exp: Diagnostic power of a screening test: Predictive accuracy (it tells the actual no. of people having the disease or not having the disease out of those shown positive or negative by a screening test) Diagnostic power of a screening test to correctly identify disease: positive predictive value (PPV) Diagnostic power of a screening test to correctly exclude a disease: negative predictive value (NPV)
topic_name: Definition and Concepts, Examples from NHPs

question: A characteristic of Diagnostic test (as compared to Screening test) is:
opa: Test results are arbitrary and final
opb: Based on one criterion or cut-off point
opd: Done on those with indications or sick
topic_name: Definition and Concepts, Examples from NHPs

question: Kaplan Meier method is used for estimating:-
exp: Kaplan Meier Survival Curve is used to estimate survival. -The area under the curve gives cumulative survival.
topic_name: Definition and Concepts, Examples from NHPs
